The correct answer is A.List<String> str = Arrays.asList ("my", "pen", "is", "your', "pen"); Check this once if it is correct then A

Selected Answer: A
Assuming that "your' is typo (using ' instead of ") answer is A, since variable i is created every time predicate is run and its value is always 0 because of post increment. And since value is found on 2nd iteration 0 is printed twice.

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D, because in the list "str" the fourth String is instantiated as "your' without double quotes as it should be. Correcting the error, the correct answer is A, pay attention to the test as the question may come with the model with compilation error or may come with the result "0 : 0 : pen"

It's A because of findFirst(), it only does the test for the first two elements, finds "pen" in the second position and terminates. Also notice "int i" is a local variable in the lambda, it always prints 0.

Answer is A.
Because Predicate test() is one test with any element in List.

questions.question_text:
Given the code fragment:
List<String> empDetails = Arrays.asList("100, Robin, HR",
"200, Mary, AdminServices",
"101, Peter, HR");
empDetails.stream()
.filter(s-> s.contains("1"))
.sorted()
.forEach(System.out::println); //line n1
What is the result?

choices.B: A compilation error occurs at line n1.
choices.C: 100, Robin, HR 101, Peter, HR 200, Mary, AdminServices
choices.D: 100, Robin, HR 200, Mary, AdminServices 101, Peter, HR

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A as String starting with 200 if filtered out since it doesn't contain 1.

choices.C: Rideable rider = Car : : new; Car vehicle = rider.getCar("MyCar");
choices.B: Car auto = Car : : new; Car vehicle = auto : : getCar("MyCar");

comments.content:
Rideable is a FunctionalInterface. 
Rideable rider = Car::new, assigns Car::new as rider's getCar() method.
So when you call rider.getCar() you are calling Car::new.

discussion.content:
Why does it work? Rideable rider = Car::new;
Class Car doesn't implement Interface Rideable! Can somebody explain it please
